channel.title: Weird Wikipedia post
channel.description:
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Last_Measure
ok this is a weird post on wikipedia, it discusses stuff like www.wowomg.com, yousuck.on.nimp.org which are called 'shock sites'
it even gives a few examples and tells u what your about to see

item.title: Weird Wikipedia post
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

You know a really weird Wikipedia post?

en.wikipedia.org

Wikipedia

Wikipedia (/ˌwɪkɪˈpiːdiə/ (listen), /ˌwɪkiˈpiːdiə/ (listen) WIK-kee-PEE-dee-ə) is a multilingual online encyclopedia, based on open collaboration through a wiki-based content editing system. It is the largest and most popular general reference work on the World Wide Web, and is one of the most popular websites ranked by Alexa as of June 2019. It features exclusively free content and no commercial ads, and is owned and supported by the Wikimedia Foundation, a non-profit organization fu Wikiped...

Read full topic

@blacker wrote:

Salemthegoodkitty:

ok fine rotten.com is cool!!! i was checking it out today… except for them showing like people with like nasty stuff coming out of their asses (long story just check out rotten) its like this weight lifeter dude lifting somethin and he gets… ya just look on rotten.com and if you find a link to www.tubgirl.com on there dont go to it i did and its just nasty!

Ya, pretty sick. Did ou see the 1 with a pic of that soldier with his head blown off? Or the dude who got decapitated by helicopter blades? Or that suicide jumper who landed on a car( WOOT! GO CARS!) I love rotten.com

item.title: Weird Wikipedia post
item.dc:creator: @oddinn686 oddinn686
item.description:
@oddinn686 wrote:

[quote=“Salemthegoodkitty, post:13, topic:19684”][quote author=oddinn686 link=topic=29878.msg344027#msg344027 date=1161667662]
Someone sent me one of those exploit things. I can’t remember where it came from. It is pretty funny though. It keeps saying “I’m looking at gay porn” over and over while opening up new windows.

I think most virus programs stop it by now, but if not, all you need to do is open the task manager and close it from there. It’s completely harmless.

Here’s the link: http://images.google.com/imgres?imgurl=:&imgrefurl=http%3A%2F%2Fw.on.nimp.org

If there’s anything wrong with posting this link, mods please remove it.

Enjoy.
[/quote]

im scared to go to the link this kid gave us… i went there and the first thing i saw was the backround and for some reason it scared the ehll out of me so i closed it! my task manager wonts come up because of a virus so i have no way of closing it…so should i go on it or not dudes?[/quote]

Ok maybe you should go to the site. I just tried it does show some pretty bad picts.

It won’t harm your computer though. At worst you’ll have to shut down your machine.

Read full topic

I was reading that and went to rotten.com thats pretty groos dude its fucking sick actually showing dead people and stuff its just nasty.
[/quote] I like rotten.com… it told me how to make Crystal Meth… thnaks to them Im almost always high… YAY ROTTEN.COM!!!

WOOT!!! and some weird people on wikipedia, was prolly guy off white n nerdy.[br][size=1]Posted at: October 23, 2006, 07:47:40 PM[/size][hr][quote author=D27L7T link=topic=29878.msg344099#msg344099 date=1161668767]
Ha. Anything.on.nimp.org links to GNAA Last Measure. The GNAA page is staying on Wikipedia, whether you guys like it or not.

Examples
http://doom3.on.nimp.org/cheats/
http://firefox.on.nimp.org/download/
http://linux.on.nimp.org/gentoo/
http://halo2.on.nimp.org/mods/
http://moparscape.on.nimp.org/serverstatus/
http://wikipedia.on.nimp.org/wiki/Harrison_Bergeron/
[/quote]
Links are not approved by mopar :)[/quote]

lawl read the rules retard, links r allowed

Read full topic

item.title: Weird Wikipedia post
item.dc:creator: @whothe0 the fu superior
item.description:
@whothe0 wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Gay Nigger Association of America

The Gay Nigger Association of America (GNAA) is an Internet trolling group. They have trolled several prominent websites and Internet personalities including Slashdot, Wikipedia, CNN, Barack Obama's campaign website, Alex Jones, and prominent members of the blogosphere. They have also released software products and leaked screenshots and information about upcoming operating systems. In addition, they maintain a software repository and a wiki-based site dedicated to Internet commentary. They M...

ok this is a weird post on wikipedia, it discusses stuff like www.wowomg.com, yousuck.on.nimp.org which are called ‘shock sites’

it even gives a few examples and tells u what your about to see
